abstract: Sebastian Vettel moves into second position in the record books for the number of pole positions in a single season.
snippet: Sebastian Vettel moves into second position in the record books for the number of pole positions in a single season.
lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI - Sebastian Vettel continued his domination of qualifying sessions this year by scoring his 13th pole position of the season at the inaugural Indian Grand Prix outside New Delhi on Saturday. Vettel joins Alain Prost and Ayrton Senna in the record books with the second largest number of pole positions in a season. Nigel Mansell holds the record of 14 pole positions, which he achieved in 1992 at Williams. With two races left in the season, Vettel has a chance to beat the record.

headline.main: New Track, Old Story:  Vettel Scores 13th Pole Position this Season
